VAEhPs45TzOnR7c4jI5sWg.text: I like this place. The fact that it's a bit hard to get to means that it's also a quiet, cosy place that fits in with the ambience of the surrounding neighbourhood. They don't charge for GST and service, which is a plus point.My favourite items on the menu are the salmon cream pasta, the all day big breakfast and the sharing platter (their sides are really awesome). The salmon cakes are also worth a shot.Service staff are really friendly and as the management is social-media savvy, checking in on Foursquare can unlock you discounts and special offers!

dNDB7taH1wTCRn6iyg-PAA.text: Cosy area in East Coast with carpark around the corner. Dogs can sit at the tables by the road. They do have a dog menu too. Do be careful to leash your pet if they love to run around. Food can be a little pricey ($120 for 2 mains, 3 sides, 1 pitcher of lemongrass drink and 1 dessert). Food is acceptable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore

gl4SnUBYOyqPHYyS9BxTsQ.text: Terribly bad place to visit in East Coast. Ordered a 6pc chicken wings and I got 3 only. They included the mid and joint wings as separate. I find that a tad dishonest but it's okay. Ordered a half platter "I see seafood" platter and it came with 3 measly pathetic small prawns, insufficient fries, 4 exact calamarai rings and charged $36 for it. This place is seriously in bad decor, overpriced and mediocre service. I don't see any reason to visit here at all. East coast is littered with places with better food and better ambience than this place. Don't bother coming here.

Lr-MoIBJDBHC44eyXLbjXQ.text: Not worth your money coming here to eat. Overpriced seafood platter. It's only their pastas that are seemingly the big portioned items. Other than that I think the rest of the items are not worth the buck here. Don't think I'll purposely make another trip back to this place.

a8XiJuFhT3EzMa6Fchu0bA.text: The setting is very casual and relaxing. It was almost like eating at a coffee shop at the old housing estates. The good weather calls for some alfresco dining, Also, i noticed that the seats inside do kinda smell of food but the diners don't seem to mind. The first thing that caught my eye was obviously "All Day Breakfasts". Breakfast is one of my favorite foods. Runny Salmon Scramble-Up ($12.50)- Creamy scrambled eggs topped with lots of smoked salmon, warm toast by side. This was heavenly. The eggs were runny as promised and had a rich creamy texture to it. The salmon provided the slight saltiness that the dish required. Only downside is that the salmon didn't seem very fresh? Didn't have a very nice bite to it? Not chewy enough i guess.My Juicy Shrimp & Roast Pumpkin ($14.90)- A rich pink sauce of tender baked pumpkin, shrimp and whole oven-roasted garlic cloves. The linguine was more on the cooked side but the plus point is that it makes it really easy to swallow (trust me that's a good thing). I was basically gobbling mouth after mouth of pasta. The sauce was light and not too sour, perfect base for a pasta marathon. I could go on eating this forever.Knickerbooker Glory Sunday ($12.50)- Vanilla gelato with Peach Melba, almond stracciatella, sea-salt dulce de leche & jaffa truffle bar. Was a crazy ass dessert. Every mouthful is a burst of flavors and the mixture was absolutely exhilarating and surprising. Some orange, then chocolate then REAL vanilla ice cream (with vanilla beans!) followed by the taste of sea salt caramel and then hitting the sweet notes with the Peach Melba again. This is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore. Yummy pasta
Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore. Scrambled eggs
Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore

Pj_6s1NUw2qLXBUXGEprQA.text: The ambience and decor of the place isn't great, doesn't have a very welcoming feel nor is it stylish - the concrete walls are painted in terracotta and left plain with wooden tables and chairs being the main decorative item - resulting in the noise bouncing off the walls and echo-ing around the cafe.  The food however is pretty decent - the burger and wedges were good, moist and tasty although the burger could have been a slightly bigger portion for its price especially when you compare it to the big breakfast your neighbour is having next to you :P  I had the ugly salmon cakes which were pretty good - the mash they used in the cakes were very buttery and tasty, but it could have done with some batter and extra time in the pan - and also some cheese I think.  Although simplicity in cooking is the key, these salmon cakes lacked a little depth in its flavour.  Otherwise no complaints, great portion size, and the salad that came with it was fresh.What I found slightly strange was the iced mocha that I ordered - it really wasn't milky enough, as you could tell instantly from the colour. It didn't taste bad, just not what an iced mocha is really! There was an overpowering taste of chocolate / cocoa powder - bit too much for my liking.

photos.caption: Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore. Burger
Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore. Iced Mocha
Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore. Ugly Salmon Cakes

n8OIJJfa9EknJMPekl2wRQ.text: I've been to Garden Slug once and would love to go back again, but because of it's location, its pretty hard to travel there.The staffs at Garden Slug are friendly and cheerful, the food there are really not bad and the ambiance of the place gives a casual dining experience. It's also a pretty good place for gatherings as they do cater to large group settings too. I think it's best if you called to reserve instead.I would recommend their soups and desserts. It not only tastes good, it looks good too! I love how they will spend time and effort in plating their food before serving it to you. A good place to try out if you haven't.

photos.caption: Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore

EL584HEziCljz-9ULtRVtw.text: The Garden Slug is the sort of place you hear about from friends or people who've been there. Reason being its quiet location in the middle of Telok Kurau. But once you discover it, you can be sure you'll keep going back for more. Wait staff and friendly and very efficient, always popping to check if you need something and even when they're at they're busiest, your orders come decently quickly. Being a pet friendly joint, you can expect many of our furry friends lazing around while they're owners enjoy their meal. The biggest draw, for me, has to be their decently prized all-day breakfast sets that are huge on portions and good on your belly. The perfect place to nurse your hangover in fact.

photos.caption: Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Garden Slug - Singapore, Singapore

rX-YMXjtf-7fPlJHqq2eqg.text: It's not an easy place to get to (especially if you live in the West like me) but I do love going to The Garden Slug. It's a home-y fun place where I can meet up with friends and just chill out (while stuffing our faces, of course). One of my favourites is the Bangers and Mash -there is also the Ultimate Bangers and Mash but I have never had the guts to try it! The last time I was there I also had the high tea set of four slices of cake + tea/coffee. It was dessert overload, but I regret nothing.They're also active on Twitter, which means that if you follow @thegardenslug you can be constantly tempted with photos of food and updates on their specials. We once even made reservations for a table via Twitter!

ZJKTnNWBdvpJ2K6wDCt3KA.text: Love this place. Only problem is the food is inconsistent. Once my scrambled eggs looked like mash omelette and the next time it was so runny almost like half boiled eggs. Service is a tad bit slow and the chairs aren't comfortable. Affordable prices but it seems recently the portions are getting smaller.

gc7Y-MLudjbO6gRHxgIB4g.text: Located at telok kurau road , this stall is one of the hidden place perhaps only the people staying in the east will know. The shop has an interesting name and logo, and it would be hard to miss the shop.This bistro restaurant menu is pretty simple to understand and the deco and interior design are cosy and warm. They provide free wifi and some reading materials for people who wish to laze their afternoon away. Food to try is their fish and chip, the fish is tender and juicy, very well prepared, the crust is crunchy giving the extra texture. And do try their signature chocolate popsicle ! It looks just like a popsicle but it is in chocolate flavor. It is even served with an ice cream stick.The owner is friendly and the price range is affordable, definitely a great place to chill out with friends  or date with you loved one.
